text: Hi Aviva! I would love to hear more about your journey, and what you've learned along the way. My background is in cloud computing and cybersecurity, I've only switched to writing in the last few months but I love it.

elements.text: Hi Aviva! I would love to hear more about your journey, and what you've learned along the way. My background is in cloud computing and cybersecurity, I've only switched to writing in the last few months but I love it.

text: <@U030VMTMP0D> Cool, I haven't even been to Banff but I'd love to go some day! Rome, yes. Other than flying in and out, I've only spent one night there. I would like to visit again and mostly eat since I've seen the main sights already :sweat_smile: I've also missed Venezia other than poking my head out for a selfie in between trains back in 2014. I've mostly explored a lot of offbeat types of towns and villages in Italy in the past 7 years but there is still much more to see!! The Netherlands has its perks but I'm missing the hills and the sea A LOT!!

text: Hi folks, what a great group! I live in the Austin, Texas area, and I've spent the last ten years as a freelance content creator & brand strategist for small businesses. I just made the move to a (remote!) 9-5 at a large edtech company (I'm specializing in SEO). I'd love to connect about all things startups/small business, SEO, branding, and parenthood; feel free to reach out here or on LinkedIn: <https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarahmguerrero/>

text: Hi <@U033T3XET3K>! I just made the opposite jump back into a fulltime role after being a freelancer for ten years. Good luck!! Love that we have so much career flexibility these days :slightly_smiling_face: A good friend of mine is from the Philippines - she's promised to make me lumpia the next time I visit her and I can't wait!

text:
Hey y’all! I’m John Doherty, founder and CEO at <http://GetCredo.com|GetCredo.com> and <http://EditorNinja.com|EditorNinja.com> plus a few other random brands around the internet. I split my time between Denver and Breckenridge Colorado with my wife, daughter, and dog.

I was a professional SEO for a long time, working at 2 agencies (notably Distilled) and then in-house for Zillow on two of their brands. I went out on my own in 2015 to self-fund Credo with my own SEO consulting, which I stopped in 2018.

Recently started <http://EditorNinja.com|EditorNinja.com> so I’m focused on growing that, while keeping Credo going strong as well. My balance is mountain therapy as often as I can get it, where I love skiing, mountain biking, and hiking depending on the season. I’m also a big bourbon fan, though I won’t often say no to an IPA (though I’m currently doing a shortened timeline version of 75hard).

text: Hello everyone! So thrilled to be here with you all. I'm in the SF Bay Area, and am a reformed T-shaped marketer who now focuses on content marketing/content strategy and marketing communications, i.e., all things words :joy:. I've worked in numerous industries and sectors at startups and enterprises alike, growing and engaging B2B and B2C communities and moving people to act through the content I create. I'm looking for a new opportunity and hope to also learn a lot and share what I know in here! More about me here: <https://merryrichter.com/> and here <http://linkedin.com/in/merryrichter/>.

text:
Hey, everyone. I’m a lead content creator (mostly SEO blogs, but also some Google Ad and website copy) at an SEM company in Richmond, VA called Veivos. I handle some account and project management there, too. I’ve only been in these role for about 1.5 years, so I’m excited to join this group and learn from everyone.

When I’m not writing words for clients, I enjoy spending time with my family (wife and son) and exercising/playing sports.

text:
Hi all! I've heard great things about this group! I'm Katie and the Client Services lead for SuperScript Marketing - a content-obsessed agency that works with financial brands.

I've been working from home for five years in Ventura, CA and always interested in the hacks people discover to optimize their work/life balance/differentiation! Great writing, in any form, is my love language.

I'm a recovering Teams user, Slack is just so much cooler. I can't wait to learn from this awesome community! Happy to be here!

text:
Hello ladies and gentlemen. My name is Amara. I am a content writer and community manager. I heard about this group on twitter and have been following tweets and I must say I am impressed.


I am chatting from Africa, Nigeria to be precise. I have been working from home as a freelancer since 2019 and it's been awesome.


I'm here to learn, get paid gigs, and build my network with like minds from all over the world. Thank God for the internet, I have met amazing people from different parts of the world.

I am a great fan of the slack platform and can find my way around. Can't wait to learn from this community. Bye bye from Nigeria.

text: Hello everyone! I am a recovering multimedia journalist in Columbus, Ohio with experience in writing, reporting, editing, videography,  photography, podcast creation,  motion design, web design/development, content creation, content stategy, graphic/document design, videography, digital marketing, digital and social media strategy, SEO, nonprofit communications, event planning and promotion, internal communications, media relations and now work in public affairs for a US government agency. Recently completed my Master of Science in Sustainability with a specialization in landscape ecology and ArcGIS. Looking to  be the connection between the natural sciences and the public through storytelling. Trying to break into science writing or data storytelling as a side hustle  but have no idea how to start. Any advice or leads are welcome. Willing to work for any outlet and am well versed in academic writing, whitepapers, blogs, short form, long form, social stories, web copy, tech advances in climate science, B2B in the sustainability/ESG arena etc.  I am also well versed and can write about military and veterans issues as I am a Air Force (Post 9/11) veteran. Looking forward to collaborating and learning from all of you!  My LinkedIn is <https://www.linkedin.com/in/stefaniehauck|https://www.linkedin.com/in/stefaniehauck>

text: Hi Stefanie! I'm wondering if you're a member of the National Association of Science Writers? I imagine you may already be--they lean toward serving journalists, but there are PIOs there who may take on freelancers ...

elements.text: Hi Stefanie! I'm wondering if you're a member of the National Association of Science Writers? I imagine you may already be--they lean toward serving journalists, but there are PIOs there who may take on freelancers ...

text: Hey Stefanie, would love to chat with you around sustainability some time. I write about computer science, but I'm starting to see demand for some overlap.
